headline: Creole Seasoning Blend
description: This Creole seasoning adds amazing flavor to rice, meats, soups, and stews with a spice blend of paprika, onion, garlic, oregano, thyme, and cayenne.

video.description: This video shows you how to make Creole seasoning with simple pantry spices. The top-rated spice mix adds flavor to rice, meats, soups, stews, or anything else in need of a flavor boost. It’s an easy way to spice up your life (and your dinner!).
video.name: Creole Seasoning Blend Recipe

name: Creole Seasoning Blend

recipeInstructions.text: Combine paprika, salt, onion powder, garlic powder, oregano, basil, thyme, black pepper, white pepper, and cayenne pepper.

review.reviewBody: Best seasoning recipe ever for beef rib roast.
This is awesome. Made it just as written. Perfect multipurpose seasoning with right amount of salt (used kosher salt) and heat. Half the recipe fits perfectly into standard size spice jar.
I absolutely love this recipe. I halve the cayenne (the husband doesn't like spicy food) and it is wonderful. I love the idea of gifting this.
This was really easy to make and tasted good on our fish.
Fabulous seasoning blend as the store bought blends contain way too much salt!
To those that found this recipe too salty; I think maybe you used table salt? I use kosher salt without that problem.
I made it with the ingredients I had on hand, omitting the onion powder and something else. Good recipe to save and have on hand.

This is an excellent seasoning recipe! The only change I made was substituting the white pepper for more black pepper. I think this blend is amazing. Not too salty. Zippy but not overly spicy. We used it on steaks and thought it was amazing. I can't wait to try it on everything.
Yes, I used it in homemade gumbo.

I used this as a steak rub - omg 
DELISH!
Then I used it as a flavoring for Prawns in a butter saute- omg
Delish!

Also have used it in eggs and I thi k it would be tasty as a roasted chickpea recipe or popcorn /butter topper- just so versatile!!

this is a keeper !
thank you!

Excellent flavor! I cut the salt in half, otherwise followed the recipe exactly as written. I like that all of the ingredients were common- I had everything on hand. 
Great recipe!

I used smoked paprika in this recipe, and kosher salt... I powdered the kosher salt in a coffee/spice grinder so that it could be more evenly distributed throughout the blend... It is a fantastic recipe... I just now made it, so other than a taste in my hand and dipping a tater tot into it, I haven't yet used it... I quadrupled the recipe off the hop and glad I did as I'll use a lot of this.
It is HOT HOT HOT!! I'd cut the cayenne next time, at least in half.
Perfect seasoning for my red beans and rice!
I don't have a lot to compare it to, but I liked it and have made it twice.
My wife made some Parmesan, Spinach, Sun dried Tomato chicken. We put approximately 3 table spoons of this mix in it!
It really added flavor to my baked chicken thighs. I did substitute red pepper flakes for cayenne pepper , but it was delicious.

It is on my spice shelf and is used quite often. I do sometime add Arroyo chilies for added spice. (I dry and use my blender to grind them). We love spicy foods here. Just on regular pork chops and steaks this Creole Seasoning is great. I'm trying it on pasta salad now and love it there too. I definitely love this and it's so easy to make.
And if you wanna use it up faster, take your spice grinder grind up some sugar and add it in. It’s a perfect popcorn seasoning.

Although I was afraid this recipe would be too spicy for my taste, I like to follow the recipe as close to the original version the first time around. This recipe did not disappoint! The only change I made was to reduce the salt to 1 Tablespoon instead of 3 Tbsp. I used a tsp in the Cajun Shrimp Soup recipe from this site & I look forward to using the rest in other dishes.
This is simple, authentic Creole seasoning - my go to for gumbo. Excellent as a rub for smoking and beer can chicken.
Great stuff. I followed the recipe exactly.

I can't have a lot of salt, so I reduced the salt to one tablespoon, and the seasoning still tastes amazing!
I like to toss popcorn with oil and sprinkle it with a bit of this for some delicious spicy movie popcorn! Tasty and healthy!
Excellent go-to recipe for Creole seasoning. Just the right amount of punch. Thank you.
Excellent! Thanks for the great recipe!
Use it all the time on just about everything
Thanks for the GREAT recipe JOSLYN. I loved it! I gave as gifts with the recipe attached and everyone I gave it to, loved it as well and they made as gifts for their friends!! Home run!

Love this blend. I’m on my second batch. Black-eyed peas and rice will never be the same. Even on regular steamed rice , I add about a teaspoonful before its done and it’s fabulous. Goes good on steamed or roasted veggies. Thanks so much!!
This is my go to season for a variety of meals. I generally cut the recipe in half to fill a 4 oz salt shaker.

I used this on a deep fried turkey and it was awesome. I still had some left over so I used it on a roast chicken. Just made another batch to do a chicken. It is now a family favorite. Love the smell of it!
Fantastic
I used kosher salt, instead of regular salt and it was perfect! I like this recipe better than store bought creole seasoning
I have a few recipes that use "creole" or "Cajun" seasoning and I wanted to make my own. I made it without the salt so I could control the level. Much better than using store bought!
An excellent blend of spices that work well together. Decreased salt to 2 tablespoons just to lower sodium but still kept very good flavor. Thanks for the great recipe!
This is perfect!
Just the right amount of spice for my Dirty Rice recipe!
I'm fairly certain this seasoning is the only thing that saved the oven-baked Jambalaya I used it for. Awesome flavor!!
Excellent and easy to make. You can easily add other seasoning to increase heat too. Thx for sharing!
Awesome on seafood and eggs ?? and pretty much any meat ?? we all love it in my large family ??????

This was pretty good. It is very similar to other spice fomulas I've made (emerel's, paul prudomme...) One suggestion, once everything is mixed whirl it in a coffee grinder or food processor to evenly blend it together. Another idea, when using this, season in layers, a little when you sweat the vegetables, a little more when adding other ingedients, a little more when adding liquids, and so on.

I used this for a Keto shrimp and grits recipe ... it was GREAT without being overly spicy. I used 1 T of salt instead of 3, per other people's recommendation that the seasoning was just a bit too salty. I made the entire recipe, and will use the rest for spreading on chicken or pork before barbecueing, etc. Thanks for providing this great seasoning!

This is pretty tasty. I love making my own seasonings and a Creole/Cajun seasoning base was missing from my spice cabinet. Made as written- except had to decrease the cayenne by 1/2 to be all household member friendly. : ) I used smoked paprika (all I have) which gives the mix a nice smoky flavor. Used it in my gumbo recipe and will definitely use it as a meat rub adding a little brown sugar and cumin for that. Thanks for posting this.
Looks great. Made it but haven’t used it yet. Looks way better then the pre-blended seasonings at the store
Good kick- used it in the Cajun chicken pasta recipe
Loved last time and had to redo. Awesome on pork or beef.
Delicious! Hotter than I expected.

My wife discovered this seasoning that I made, in the pantry and decided to try it....... that was a month ago. She loves it enough that I just made my second batch today. My only change is that I cut down on the salt - to one tablespoon, otherwise, this is a great seasoning blend to use on many preparations..... thank you
Used it in a shrimp and Andouille Sausage Jambalaya. Was just the right flavor. Thank you.

I’ve used this recipe several times, as a sub for store bought. It’s delicious! Since my first use I have cut back on the peppers a bit because of my younger kids but it doesn’t detract much from the original flavor. Excellent recipe!

I seasoned halibut steak with this blend and it turned out tasty. I made 1/3 of the recipe (tsp instead of tbsp) to start just to make sure I really like it to make a large batch. Cooking for 2 people, I only used very little to season the fish. There is still quite a bit left and I kept it in a jar. I used 2 tsp salt instead of 3. I think oregano was a little too overpowering. And we love spicy food. So next time I'll used 1.5 tsp oregano, 1.5 tsp cayenne, and no salt. It should be good for different meat in many recipes including soups and stocks. Thanks for the recipe! It saved me money attempting to buy Emeryl's seasoning.

I use this on almost everything. I make a big batch and then change it up by sprinkling on more of a particular ingredient or adding something like cumin to change the flavor. It’s the base seasoning for just about everything now. Guests have loved the flavor. A pinch of sugar when cooking adds a little something too. I make my base with half the white pepper because it was too spicy for some. Then I just sprinkle some white pepper if making something for adults who like spicy. Rave reviews on all kinds of different meat and vegetables to.

THANK YOU! I am allergic to black pepper, of all things, so pre-made spice mixes are impossible to use. I've tried several different creole spice recipes that just never taste quite right... with yours I substituted toasted white pepper for the black and wah-lah... PERFECT on my crawfish! (and chicken, and rice, and...)

Absolutely delicious! My family is in love with this seasoning. It has this gorgeous smokey taste to it and goes well with anything. I have made it a few times and always make extra to store for later!

Wow and Wow again!! I mixed this up and used it in red beans and rice I made for my vegetarian daughter. I cut back the cayenne to half (cause I am such a wimp when it comes to spicier food). The recipe was not harmed by adjusting the heat to my taste. This is beyond a doubt the best recipe spice mix I have ever used. Many Kudos and thank you so much for taking the time to post and share.
Quite enjoyable. Thank you for the recipe.
I used this in remoulade sauce to serve with fried oysters. It was easy to put together and had just the right spiciness for my dish
Fourth time I've made a large batch. Great recipe as is

We use this creole seasoning on and in many dishes we prepare for our families. It is our "go to" seasoning for meat, fish and veggies. We follow the recipe exactly as written for adults, but we also make a milder version for our kids. Excellent recipe!

I didn't have some of the spices and also needed to tone down the heat so that my kids would eat this.... Used: 4-tbsp Garlic Powder, 1.5-tbsp Oregano, 1.5-tbsp Basil, 3/4-tsp Black Pepper, 1-tsp Cayenne, 4-tbsp Paprika, 2-tbsp Salt. Great seasoning. Used over my tilapia for my Garlic Alfredo Tilapia tonight - yum!

This is a great spice blend (although I often cut back on the cayenne since my daughter doesn't enjoy spicy foods). I use it in the Quick and Easy Black Beans and Rice recipe also found on this site. It is a great combination.
This is delicious! Thank you for recipe. I used very little cayenne because of young ones and still spicy! Yummy!
This seasons need not be under how you make jambalaya, because this ruined it
Delicious, but I had to cut back on the cayenne pepper due to my little ones. Great recipe! Now I know exactly what I'm putting on my food. That's always a plus.
My guys loved it. Used for jambalaya.

For the first time I made Jambalaya without a mix. I I divided this recipe by half and added it to beef stock. Then added 6 cups of water along with 4 packets of chicken stock. I waited until I had it all at a full boil before adding the rice (2c) brought that down to a low simmer, covered and let cook 20 minutes. I didn't have cayenne pepper or white pepper so I kept the full amount of black pepper. I added some sliced precooked sausages. My son says it's the best Jambalaya I ve ever made.
Made it! We use it for a lot of things do to the versatility of the spices. It is awesome.
Tastes great on chicken, as long as it's prepared right.

I found this recipe about 6 months ago when my sister-in-law from Louisiana told me that a bottle of prepared creole seasoning is not "real" creole cooking. So I made this up for a recipe I had for shrimp and sausage pasta. It was awesome! We use this on most things we cook for a flo or boost. The opportunities are endless from veggies, fish, potatoes, smoke rub and so much more. I made

I will definitely make this seasoning mix again; the balance of flavors was spot on for us. However, it did not have enough spice for a creole seasoning in my opinion. I have a 9, 10, and 12 year old--two of which added more of Tony's Cajun seasoning to spice it up. I will add more cayenne next time I mix it up. And I will be using it again. Just know that you will have to play with the peppers to find the amount of heat that your family prefers.
It's perfect! Love it so much

This is a fantastic recipe. I followed it exactly as per the instructions and thought that I would modify if I felt it was required for our household. I wouldn't recommend changing a thing. It is definitely not really "hot" but just right for us. You could even make it a bit hotter.
I have used this for a ton of other things as well. Great on fish, meats, sandwiches, etc. Excellent!!
Used this for jambalya....so tasty
Love this seasoning. Great on just about anything.
great versatile creole spice easily tailored to your families taste!! I used only 1/2 the cayenne as my husband can't do too spicy would make great bbq gift!!!
Very flavorful. I put in all listed ingredients except cayenne. My husband doesn't do hot anymore. It was still spicy and tasty.

Good Creole Seasoning to keep on hand and far better than what you will get at the store (no MSG and no additional strange ingredients). I would recommend adding additional amounts of this seasoning blend as needed, per your taste. Start with the amount called for in a recipe and add more as needed. Also, I'll probably leave out the salt next time. It wasn't too salty at all for us, but I find it easier to add salt as needed in the cooking process. Will be making a larger batch to readily keep on hand! Thanks for sharing the recipe!

I used this to make Maple Cajun Mahi Mahi from this site, and it turned out very well. The spice was nice, with a kick, but not too hot to handle. *Update 2/23/17- I make this and keep it on hand all the time. It works well for gift giving too.
I loved it!!! Will
This was just way too salty. I baked chicken with this and we could only eat a few pieces and had to toss the rest. I've wasted all those good spices and herbs and chicken...

I needed a creole seasoning for the recipe "Simple Baked Chicken Breasts", by Always Cooking Up Something, which is also on this site. This Creole seasoning blend is absolutely perfect! You don't need more than a very light coating; just a few pinches on each side for a very light dusting on the two chicken breasts I made! Scrumptious flavor and I am thinking it would also be awesome on BBQ'd back ribs! This is a keeper for sure and it keeps in an air tight container too! I will use it again soon!
I made this seasoning to go with the kale and quinoa with creole seasoning recipe on All Recipes and it was perfect. I will make sure to always have this seasoning in my cupboard.

I did not make any changes, and it was easy to put together. As one person stated it's nothing grand, but the great thing about it is that it's so versatile. It can be used on almost every type of food. I speak from experience, (although now retired) I owned and operated a 63 seat restaurant for 30 years. I will make it again.

Easy, practical, affordable!!! Love that you can have your creole seasoning fresh!!! I prepared just what I needed for my dish: I halved the quantities and also instead of tablespoon I used teaspoon, maintaining the relation of all ingredients.

I made this for a roast turkey I did for my co-workers. I did a 1:1 ratio on all of the ingredients except for salt and paprika. I left the salt out because I was brining the turkey and it would have been too salty with extra salt. The paprika I did 5:1. I wanted the flavor to be able to permiate deep into the meat so, I put all of the ingredients into my blendtec blender and turned it into a fine powder. The turkey turned out perfect and all of my co-workers raved about it. There was nothing left of the turkey! Because it's now a powder I may need to add some to keep it from clumping.
This was awesome! I use it on lots of different things. My son will ask, "mom, can you make something for dinner using that Creole seasoning"? It's even amazing on fries!!!
Great mix! I make it in large quantities and use it on pork, chicken and veggies. We especially love it on baked chicken wings. Thanks for the great recipe!
Thank you for this my family wanted red beans and rice and this helped out as I everything but creole seasoning.
Great flavor! Decreased salt to 1 Tbl. Added 1 Tbl celery seed. Excellent to keep on hand for spicing up any dish.

This is by far the best Cajun seasoning I have used. I put it in the Cajun Chicken Pasta (recipe found in AR). It has just enough heat but definitely not too much. It can be blended with oil and used as a marinade. Also it would be great mixed with mayonnaise and used as a dip. 5 stars!

Great for Blackened Chicken.
I used this spice blend to make blackened chicken. My husband said, "I could eat this chicken every day and be very happy!" The only change I made to the recipe was to add a little chipolte pepper to the blend (about half the the amount of cayenne pepper the recipe calls for). I will use this spice blend again and again!
Love this. Use it a lot, nice blend. Rice, meats, fish. Can't go wrong

Perfect seasoning for chicken. I boil up several lbs of chicken breasts, shred with hand mixer, and add this seasoning to the shredded meat. The meat is great on top of salads, in tacos, or just as a snack right out of the fridge .
thus stuff is sooo good! we've been coating jo-jos with it then tossing them on the grill
Great combination of spices! It only took me a few minutes to combine the spices, which I already had on hand. I look forward to adding this to many Cajun dishes.

Just what I needed without having to run to the store. I used a new (for me) Spanish Paprika and found it to be a little overpowering, no problem, will just have to adjust next time. It's nice to be able to adjust the heat level for each dish, THANKS!
I cut the recipe to a 1/3, and it still made a large spice bottle full.

The best seasoning that exists by far. Melt some butter and mix the creole seasoning with the melted butter, eat with fresh bread and you have the best meal in the world. One thing though when done by this recipe the result is way too salty. I would reduce the salt by half.

Made a small batch of this. I used it as a rub on pork tenderloin. It was tasty. My dinner guests all liked it and asked for the recipe. It had just enough kick to it. Not too spicy. I did find it a bit salty,but I served a mushroom creme sauce with it so that offset the saltiness. Will make it again, but reduce the salt.
Did not use any salt. Still a great seasoning!
